name: Malta
description: Malta, an archipelago nation in the Mediterranean Sea, boasts a rich history, unique geology, and stunning natural beauty. Characterized by its three main islands – Malta, Gozo, and Comino – the country offers a diverse landscape ranging from dramatic cliffs and ancient temples to picturesque coastal towns and fertile valleys.  Its strategic location has shaped its cultural heritage, resulting in a fascinating blend of influences from Phoenicians, Romans, Arabs, Normans, and the British.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Malta is relatively small, contributing to a strong sense of community.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides on the main island of Malta.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Malta is a small island nation with a compact geographical footprint.
quickFacts.detail: It's roughly the size of Singapore.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Valletta, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is the historic capital and a stunning example of Baroque architecture.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: Maltese is the official language, while English is widely spoken and used in government and business.
quickFacts.detail: Italian is also spoken by a significant portion of the population.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The official currency before the Euro was the Maltese Lira.

quickFacts.label: Average Temperature
quickFacts.description: Malta enjoys a mild Mediterranean climate.
quickFacts.detail: Summer temperatures can reach 30°C, while winters are generally mild.

climateData.title: Mediterranean Climate
climateData.description: Malta experiences a classic Mediterranean climate characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters.  The sea plays a crucial role in moderating temperatures, resulting in relatively stable conditions throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Long, sunny days and warm temperatures make summer the peak tourist season. Rainfall is minimal.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to cool down, and rainfall increases slightly. The landscape transforms with vibrant autumn colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild winters with occasional rainfall.  Days are short, but the weather remains pleasant for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures rise, flowers bloom, and the landscape comes alive. It's a beautiful time to visit Malta.

naturalWonders.name: Ħaġar Qim Temples
naturalWonders.description: Ħaġar Qim Temples are among the oldest freestanding structures in the world, dating back to the Neolithic period. These remarkable megalithic temples offer a glimpse into Malta's ancient past.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located near the Blue Grotto, these temples are aligned with the sunrise on the summer solstice, suggesting their importance in ancient rituals. The site is remarkably well-preserved, showcasing the ingenuity of the builders.

naturalWonders.name: Blue Grotto
naturalWonders.description: The Blue Grotto is a sea cave system renowned for its stunning azure waters. Sunlight filtering through an underwater opening creates a mesmerizing spectacle.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Accessible by boat, the Blue Grotto offers a surreal experience with its intensely blue hues. The color is caused by the reflection of sunlight on the limestone walls and the scattering of light by water particles.
viewingTips: Check the weather conditions before visiting

naturalWonders.name: Dingli Cliffs
naturalWonders.description: Dingli Cliffs are the highest point in Malta, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the Mediterranean Sea.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These dramatic cliffs are composed of limestone and provide a habitat for various seabirds. The sheer drop to the sea below is a sight to behold.

ecosystemData.title: Malta's Coastal Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Malta's coastal ecosystems are diverse and fragile, shaped by the island's unique geology, climate, and maritime environment.  They provide vital habitats for a wide range of species and play a crucial role in protecting the coastline.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: The Mediterranean Sea surrounding Malta is home to a rich variety of marine life, including fish, crustaceans, mollusks, and marine mammals.

statistics.details: Diverse species including tuna, swordfish, and grouper.
Small coral reefs are present but vulnerable to climate change.

notableSpecies.name: Mediterranean Monk Seal
notableSpecies.significance: One of the rarest marine mammals in the Mediterranean.

notableSpecies.name: Striped Marlin
notableSpecies.significance: A migratory species important for the marine ecosystem.

biodiversityCategories.name: Terrestrial Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Malta's terrestrial ecosystems include Mediterranean maquis shrubland, rocky cliffs, and agricultural land, supporting a variety of bird species and reptiles.

statistics.details: Migratory birds rely on Malta as a stopover point.
Lizards and snakes are common in the maquis shrubland.

notableSpecies.name: Eleonora's Falcon
notableSpecies.significance: A rare raptor that breeds on the cliffs of Gozo.

notableSpecies.name: Green Lizard
notableSpecies.significance: A widespread lizard found in various habitats.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Malta
activities.description: Malta offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Malta's diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Azure Window Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail leading to the base of the Azure Window (now collapsed).

activities.name: Dingli Cliffs Hike
activities.description: A short hike along the dramatic Dingli Cliffs.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Mediterranean Sea with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the underwater world of Malta's clear waters.

activities.name: Diving
activities.description: Discover shipwrecks and marine life with a diving excursion.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, scarf, gloves

safety: Be aware of the sun's intensity
